column11: If you travel to Matara, Madiha, or even a little further away from Polhena Beach, it is well worth it to take a dip with these beautiful creatures. After trying twice and failing twice I decided to get a guide. The cost was virtually nothing, but as soon as I was in the water the guide zoned in on a Olives Ridley turtle and there he was, plucking grass from the seabed and passing the food t me, to pass to the turtles. I don't necessarily agree with this hand feeding by tourists but I think this little act could be helping the turtles to stay popular, which in turn encourages locals to protect their investment and keep the beaches clean. I was called to the beach one particular evening by a Tuk-Tuk driver and I actually saw a turtle laying her eggs. Truly spectacular. The turtle had a big scar on its back due to, I was told, a shark attack. I sat in a small restaurant one day for several hours and watched the feeding turtles' heads popping up and down in the surf, without any interruption or intervention from humans. There is very little input from humans here and I think it is one of the best places in the whole of Sri Lanka to view these several different species of beautifully wild sea creatures.

column11: Polhena Beach is one of the safest beach to swim because the waves do not come in as it is sheltered by a reef ofshore. it will be like swimming in a swimming pool. it is located about 5 kms from Matara town. Matara is connected to Colombo via a Southern expressway so your travel time is just 2 hours. You do not have to enter Matara town. You will exit the southern expressway and head towards Matara town. In the second signal (T-junction) turn right into the Galle road and you will have to drive for about 3 kms. it is also connected by train. Train journey will take about 3 1/2 hours. Most part of train journey is close to the sea coast and there are many a time during the journey you can see beaches from the train. From Matara town or train station you can take a tuk tuk for less than 500 LKR. You can also take a local bus that goes to Weligama or Galle and take a tuk tuk from the main road. To reach the beach you will have to drive less than a km from the main road ( Matara - Galle road). the road close to the beach will be narrow so you will have to give way for the on coming traffic by pulling aside. Parking should not be a problem. You also have a bathing place where you can shower and change after you swim in the beach. There are hotels available if you want to stay overnight or spend a couple of days there. For us it was a day trip so we did not explore this. Neither did we explore the restaurants since we packed our lunch and snakcs. There are also shops selling you beach wears so you do not have to worry if you are not carrying one. The water will be only about waist high till the reef formation. You can swim safely . Even a person who did not know swimming was able to enjoy myself in the water for more than 2 hours with no fear of drowning. if you are looking for surfing this may not be the place for you. There are also no shades where you can camp on the shore. So you need to carry a beach umbrella to set up camp.

column11: Nirosh Hewa, a charming man born in Polhena, knows all about TURTLES - and he is eager to take you to a snorkeling trip. column11: Well as I grew up in Matara area, I have no idea about this whole "Nishantha" thing.  As this is a public beach take your map out and go visit it. Its not hard to find the beach front and you just have to take the left turn from the Polhena Junction which directly goes to the beach. So this beach is exceptional compared to other beaches in the Southern Coast line. Polhena Beach is covered by a natural rock wall which has made the beach in to a natural pool. You can barely see waves within 200M and It's pretty safe to swim close to the beach (But do no go too far, as there are some underwater swirls time to time) . As I was schooling we had swimming contests in the beach by converting the beach in to a Pool by partitioning it with lines. The sand on the beach is not soft as in Matara beach but its not rough as in Colombo beaches. If you are planning to relax, swim and have fun in Southern coast line
